text:
Morning Everyone,

I have a query that I need some help with.

I have made changes to the quotes that it adds 20% VAT automatically on the subtotal of the quote and displays it below the subtotal -> attached screenshot for reference.

So at the bottom of line items the quote is shows as : Subtotal
                                                                                            VAT
                                                                                           Total

However, the problem we are facing is that when paying with Stripe, the payment amount is pulled from Subtotal and not the total. Does anyone know where I can make changes so that the payment amount is pulled from the Total.

Thank you

Hi all! :wave:
I have a mirror of <http://adventure.ziflow.com|adventure.ziflow.com> hosted on <http://adventure.ziflow.io|adventure.ziflow.io> (cloudfront) but it is being redirected to .com for no exact reason - apparently HubSpot is causing this since short time ago. I haven't changed anything on a HubSpot domain settings. Any clue what might happened and how to fix this?

Our dev team used this manual <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/reverse-proxy-support>

```curl -v <https://adventure.folderflow.com>

We want the HubSpot Developer community to be inclusive and welcoming. By following our Code of Conduct, you can help ensure that's the case.

TL;DR:
• Be respectful
• Be inclusive (try not to say, "Hey guys, hey boys, hey [any specific group]")
• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs
Read the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|whole thing here> - and thanks for being a part of the HubSpot Developer Community!

Want to report a violation? DM <@UQNEXHW14> or fill out the <https://form.asana.com/?k=p7aM0fpd3G4JGETDL_nYXg&d=8587152060687|anonymous form here>.

Hi Everyone
Does anyone know how to rotate secrets for an App published on the HubSpot Marketplace?
 i ahve an app published (appId: 222298) i have to rotate the secrets due to a security policy on my company.
in contact with Support chat, they told this is the correct place to ask.
Appreciate if anyone can help me here
As per <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/How-to-rotate-our-client-secret/m-p/416670> looks like you can’t do it yourself. <@UD53A9UUR> said they could do it on the HubSpot side.
I would try setting validation rules on the field corresponding to the form field

From quickly glancing over a couple of forum threads, it is not possible. <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/VAT-gets-lost-for-recurring-payments/idi-p/313363> Suggests creating a line item on the quote for tax specifically so that it shows up in the sub total, then stripe will pick it up.

Hi all,
I have a chatbot installed on a web app.
I am using this to identify a user on the app
```     _hsq.push([
      'identify',
      {
       id: this.user.id,
       email: this.user.workEmail,
       firstName: this.user.firstName,
       lastName: this.user.lastName,
       workspace: this.workspace?.name,
       web_app_user: 'Yes'
      }
     ])
     _hsq.push(['trackEvent'], {})
    }```
What happens is, for the first message a user sends, HubSpot asks for email and this conversation shows up as an unknown user in conversations in HubSpot.
If the user sends another message then the chatbot recognizes the user.
So I am struggling to understand why would the user not be identified in the first message itself.
Thank you in advance :slightly_smiling_face:
